qas.question: What is sometimes used to check the accuracy of a translation?

answers.text: Comparison of a back-translation with the original text

qas.question: What operations are results from not always completely reliable?
What symbol set has a defining property of ambiguity?
What symbol set has the property of being intentionally unequivocal?

plausible_answers.text: Comparison of a back-translation with the original text

qas.question: What is no longer used to check the accuracy of a translation?
What symbol set has no defining property of ambiguity?
What symbol set has the property of being unintentionally unequivocal?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Comparison of a back-translation with the original text<b5_0/><a0_0/> is sometimes used as a check on the accuracy of the original translation, much as the accuracy of a mathematical operation is sometimes checked <a1_0><b6_0>by reversing the operation<b6_0/><a1_0/>. But the results of such <a2_0><b7_0>reverse-translation operations<b7_0/><a2_0/>, while useful as approximate checks, are not always precisely reliable. Back-translation must in general be less accurate than back-calculation because <a3_0><b8_0>linguistic<b8_0/><a3_0/> symbols (words) are often ambiguous, whereas <a4_0><b9_0>mathematical<b9_0/><a4_0/> symbols are intentionally unequivocal.
